text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with clotted cream that's right do
not let the odd name and strange
appearance throw you off clotted cream
is one of the most delicious things in
existence but unfortunately so few
people get to taste it and when you
consider how amazing this is and how
easy it is to make I have absolutely no
idea why it's not more popular well
actually I do have an idea
they called it clotted cream so no not
the most appetizing name ever but anyway
that aside unless you live in a very
specific part of England the only way to
taste the real stuff is to make our own
in the good news is we only need one
ingredient to do that and that would be
two pints of the best heavy cream you
can find okay as you can tell by the
glass bottles I went to the fancy
grocery store and got some gorgeous
local milk from grass-fed cows that's
right some dairy farms actually feed the
cows what they're supposed to eat which
is nice and what we'll do is go ahead
and pour our cream into some kind of
shallow baking dish and I would say
something about eight or nine inches
square would be ideal all right we want
to do something where our cream ends up
to be about an inch and a half to two
inches deep so we'll go ahead and pour
our cream in and then once that's at
what we have to do next is absolutely
nothing that's it we're done
this is ready for the oven which reminds
me you're actually gonna want to start
this late at night because what we're
gonna do is transfer this into the
center of a very low oven set somewhere
between 175 and 200 and believe it or
not we're actually going to leave that
cream in there for 12 hours
oh yeah we're pulling an all-nighter
well actually the cream is we're gonna
go to sleep and check it in the morning
and if everything's gone according to
plan 12 hours later it should look
something like this which yes does look
quite bizarre but don't be afraid that's
exactly what it's supposed to look like
and then what we're gonna need to do at
this point is let this cool down to room
temperature I know you've waited 12
hours and you want to taste it but you
can't we really need to let this cool
down completely so I let mine sit out on
the counter for at least an hour and
then once that's been accomplished we're
getting very close all we need to do at
this point is wrap it up and pop it in
the fridge overnight no I'm not kidding
before we can use this it has to chill
completely but that's okay it's going to
be totally worth it so that's what I did
and then the next morning I pulled it
out and unwrapped it and finally I get
to show you what happened here so let me
go ahead and grab a spoon so I can lift
up what we're calling our clotted cream
and basically what's occurred during
that long slow cooking process our cream
is sort of separated with the richest
fattiest part sort of floating to the
top in the milky liquid part sort of
settling to the bottom and it's this
gorgeous rich fatty creamy stuff here
that we call the clotted cream and while
I really do enjoy the appearance of this
stuff the taste is absolutely
otherworldly it is so rich and decadent
and that cream is taken on kind of a
sweet nutty flavor that I'm pretty sure
you cannot recreate using any other
method just insanely insanely good but
anyway I want to taste some more later
for now we need to separate the thick
from the thin and by the way don't even
think for a second we're going to be
discarding this thinner stuff okay we're
going to do is pour that stuff into a
bowl and we're gonna save that to make
scones or biscuits with to serve with
the clotted cream
it's the perfect system so not to brag
but that's what I did and then once
that's been poured off all the rest can
get packed into a container or crock oh
by the way if you want some people
prefer to mix that buttery crust into
the mixture but I don't I prefer the
more authentic presentation but either
way that'll be up to you you are her
majesty the queen of your homemade
clotted cream so mix that in if you want
but I do enjoy seeing a little bit of
that golden-brown buttery goodness and
that's it our clotted cream is ready to
enjoy hopefully I'm submiss ckets or
scones we made with that amazingly
delicious liquid we reserved so let's go
ahead and slide around a generous
helping of our clotted cream and then I
finish mine off with some homemade

one of the most uniquely delicious
things you'll ever eat I mean just
absolutely to die for
possibly literally I mean I can't decide
whether this stuff tastes like the
world's creamiest butter or the world's
butter Griest cream but either way if

so stay tuned for that but in the
